meanings.definition: A yoke or harness for animals
meanings.sent1: The farmer placed the jugum on the oxen before plowing the field.
meanings.sent2: The jugum helped the horses pull the heavy cart.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat managed to slip out of the jugum and run around the farm.
meanings.sent4: The bond between the horse and the jugum symbolized their teamwork and cooperation.
meanings.sent5: The worn-out jugum creaked as the oxen pulled the plow through the field.

meanings.definition: A ridge connecting two mountain peaks
meanings.sent1: The climbers carefully navigated the narrow jugum between the peaks.
meanings.sent2: The jugum offered a breathtaking view of the valleys below.
meanings.sent3: The adventurous hikers decided to have a picnic on the jugum.
meanings.sent4: The jugum stood as a natural bridge between the towering mountains.
meanings.sent5: The sun set behind the jugum, casting a shadow over the valley.

meanings.definition: A unit of measurement equal to 28.8 square feet
meanings.sent1: The garden was measured to be exactly one jugum in size.
meanings.sent2: The field required three jugums of fertilizer for proper coverage.
meanings.sent3: The real estate agent estimated the property to be around five jugums.
meanings.sent4: The farmer calculated the area of the land using jugums as the unit.
meanings.sent5: The rug in the living room covered half a jugum of the floor.
